name: Ambassador Hotel Downtown / Utica Square

reviews.title: Outstanding!
reviews.text: This was one of the best hotel experiences I have ever had. The room was spacious and very comfortable - more like a bedroom in a home. The staff was prompt and courtious. They provided a local shuttle service (in a town car) that was very convenient. The location is a bit remote from downtown, but easy to get to from about anywhere. Great small hotel!

reviews.title: Charming boutique hotel in Tulsa
reviews.text: We enjoyed two nights in one of the hotel's suites overlooking downtown Tulsa. This consisted of a bedroom, living room and very spacious bath. Lots of light from the operable windows in this corner suite... very clean with comfortable furniture and bed. WIth only seven rooms or suites per floor, this hotel is very quiet.

reviews.title: Felt Like Royalty
reviews.text: One word of caution. While evening service in the on-premise Chalkboard Restaurant was fine, breakfast service both mornings was slow and disorganized. With only about one half of tables occupied, it took 30 minutes + to receive our food. Menu is interesting and food is good.

reviews.title: wonderful ambassador
reviews.text: From the minute we arrived we felt pampered. The ambiance of the hotel lobby was wonderful. The staff were amazing and personable. We requested a bottle of wine after the restaurant was closed and it was brought up by the manager himself. The executive room was huge and the bed was extremely comfortable. The room was understated but plush. I only wish my bedroom at home was this nice. We are going to make this our regular hotel for romantic weekends in Tulsa. The downstairs restaurant was very nice although the service was a little slow.

reviews.title: Truly a Gem in Tulsa
reviews.text: Everything about this hotel from the staff's knowledge of its history, to the service, to the comfort of the room was truly a remarkable experience and well-worth repeating at a future time.

reviews.title: Charming old boutique hotel
reviews.text: It is above average but we were dissappointed. I had wanted to stay here for years but could never pass up the great prices at the Doubletree - so when the Doubletree was fully booked, we booked a room at the Ambassador. They had plenty of rooms available so I asked at check-in about a free upgrade and they actually laughed. Our room was cramped, the toilet leaked, and the bathroom door wouldn't close. I'm glad we tried it but won't be back. The attached restaurant is excellent and should not be missed when in Tulsa!

reviews.title: Another satisfied traveler.
reviews.text: We spent four nights right before Christmas.

reviews.title: Beautiful comfort
reviews.text: The hotel was clean, quiet (except for one incident that will be explained later) and well-kept. The staff was attentive and cordial.

reviews.title: Romantic Getaway
reviews.text: We had a double queen suite (w/ custom-made beds which may be too soft for some people)that was on the south side of the building. The sound of the train yard across the river may be a bit more prominent on this side at night.

reviews.title: Luxurious hotel for a getaway
reviews.text: The hotel, on the National Register of Historic buildings, is south of downtown Tulsa in a quiet and safe area of office buildings. It's within walking distance (just ask my wife)of the 15th St./Cherry Street district that is home to some of Tulsa's better restaurants and shops. Riverpark is also very close.

reviews.title: Perfect Wedding Night
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night in October and it was absolutely perfect. We had to leave so early the next morning to get to the airport and they even shuttled us out early in the van even though it wasn't supposed to open for another 20 minutes. We had their honeymoon suite (not the top notch room but it felt like it to us!) and it was amazing. Their beds could not be any better. We can't wait to go back so we can try the restaurant too!!

reviews.title: Best in Tulsa
reviews.text: Best hotel in Tulsa. I travel to this fine city once or twice a month on business and have stayed at most hotels within the city limits. Room Service is great - dinners I've had here rival the top notch fare I've had in Manhattan hotels. I've even had the hotel van offered to me when my taxi never showed up. Now, that's great service!

reviews.title: Extremely impressed
reviews.text: I travel extensively for buisness and as a result I have very high standards for hotels. The Ambassador was absolutely excellent. Beautiful and elegant rooms, wonderful staff, great restaurant -- I will find excuses to stay in Tulsa from now on.

reviews.title: The perfect getaway
reviews.text: My husband and I booked the Romance package at the Ambassador Hotel for our anniversary...and it was perfect. We were greeted with champagne and chocolates as well as an immaculate suite. We will definitely be returning.

reviews.title: The most romantic hotel in Tulsa
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here on our wedding night after seeing some of the "suites" in other upscale downtown chain hotels. The Ambassador could not have been more wonderful. We stayed in one of the suites -- definitely the most luxurious room, but I've seen the corner king and king with deluxe bathroom as well, and they are also wonderful.

reviews.title: Love Staying at the Ambassador!
reviews.text: I love to stay at the Ambassador! It is a smaller, very nice hotel in downtown Tulsa. As a woman who travels alone, I enjoy that I feel safe when staying there. It does cost a little more but well worth it!

reviews.title: Finally a nice place to come back to
reviews.text: After staying at several places in Tulsa when coming up to visit my husband, we have finally found a place that was welcoming and extremely comfortable. You could tell it was a nice place as soon as you stepped in the front doors. The staff was so helpful & friendly when we were checking in & out and was really helpful in giving good directions to other places in Tulsa (ie: restaurants). The Ambassador suite was spectacular and the bed was the most comfortable bed I have ever slept on away from home. The feather-top matress just seemed to wrap around me giving me a great night sleep. The cost was a little pricy (but I beleive you get what you pay for). We have stayed at other "pricy" hotels, but they don't even stand close to the Ambassador. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

reviews.title: Romantic getaway
reviews.text: My husband and I have been there 3 times in the last 4 years. It is a wonderfully romantic place. Everyone is so helpful and service is quick (ie. towels, ice, water).The corner rooms with the hot tubs are great. This place gets my vote everytime!

reviews.title: Valentine's Day at the Ambassador
reviews.text: My husband surprized me with an overnight stay at this historic hotel in downtown Tulsa. We appreciated the charm of a smaller hotel immediately upon entering the lobby. The staff were pleasant, but too busy to give the extra personal service we were expecting. Our room was quite nice, large windows, beautiful draperies, extra chairs and settes. The bathroom was a tad disapointing for a $200 per night stay, but the room itself was nicer than most. The immediate area does not offer much in the way of shopping or dinning, but w/in a few miles are many options for both.

reviews.title: Great experience
reviews.text: I stayed in the Ambassador this past weekend and found the hotel to be clean, well maintained and well run. The furnishings are high quality and the recent rehab shows good workmanship and many high end touches (ie crown moulding, 1 inch wooden blinds, stone tile etc). Housekeeping is very good with the room and common areas clean and dust free (even the corners of the elevators were clean).

description: Listed on the National Registry of Historic Places, the luxurious Ambassador Hotel is a true Tulsa treasure. It was established in 1929 to provide temporary housing for wealthy oil barons while they waited for their estates to be built. The Mediterranean-style property changed functions over the years until being restored into a quaint boutique hotel. Personalized customer service and large, elegant rooms make this one of the city's finest hotels. The wide range of amenities is sure to please the most discerning traveler.
